article.headline: West Virginia 83, Wash & Jefferson 33
article.story: MORGANTOWN, W.Va. (AP) -- Kevin Pittsnogle scored 23 points Saturday as West Virginia beat Division III opponent Washington & Jefferson 83-33. Pittsnogle scored 14 points in 14 minutes of first half action. He finished with a game high 23, hitting four three-pointers on 8-13 shooting. One of three Mountaineers to score in double-figures, Pittsnogle also used a 3-inch height advantage over his Washington & Jefferson defender, center Josip Lucic-Jozak, to grab 8 rebounds. Lucic-Jozak recorded his first double-double of the season, scoring 12 points and adding 10 rebounds. Mike Gansey and Joe Herber were the other Mountaineers in double-figures, scoring 12 and 10, respectively. West Virginia (4-3) overwhelmed Washington & Jefferson (0-5) from the tip-off. Washington & Jefferson gave up 23 turnovers that West Virginia converted for 29 points. The game opened with eight straight West Virginia points, and Washington & Jefferson never got closer than six from there. West Virginia led 48-25 at halftime. In the second half, Washington & Jefferson gained only eight points and went 7:52 between baskets. Saturday's game was the first matchup between the schools since 1951. The teams now have played 67 times, with West Virginia winning 40 times.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
